tooltip.title: Lock from updates
tooltip.html: Select this option to prevent updates to the selected devices. Click Lock to save your changes.

tooltip.title: Lock from deletion
tooltip.html: Select this option to prevent the selected devices from being deleted. Click Lock to save your changes.

tooltip.title: Send an event when an action is blocked
tooltip.html: Select this option to create an event when a blocked action (such as update or deletion) is attempted. Click Lock to save your changes.

tooltip.title: Remove Devices
tooltip.html:
Select one or more devices, and then click to display the Remove Devices dialog.
You can choose to remove the devices from undefined state, or delete them from the system.
To confirm your changes, click Remove.

Just remove from undefined
Select this option to remove selected devices from undefined state.

Delete completely
Select this option to remove selected devices from the system.

Add Devices
Click to add a device in the selected device class.

Actions
From this menu, you can:
Lock devices - Prevent selected devices from being updated or deleted.
Reset IP - Reset the IP addresses of selected devices to the results of a DNS lookup.
Reset Community - Reset the SNMP community strings of selected devices.
Set Production State - Select a production state (Production, Pre-Production, Test, Maintenance, or Decommissioned) for selected devices.
Set Priority - Set a priority (from Trivial to Highest) for selected devices. Setting a priority allows you to "rank" your devices, and then use those settings to control alerts.
Set Collector - Select a collector for selected devices.
Select one or more devices, and then select a command to run in the interface.

Production State Production StateSelect one or more devices, and then select a production state:
Production - Devices are monitored and appear on the dashboard; remote alerts are sent.
Pre-Production - Devices are monitored. They do not appear on the dashboard, and no remote alerts are sent.
Test - Devices are monitored and remote alerts are sent; device information does not appear on the dashboard.
Maintenance - Devices are monitored and may appear on the dashboard; no remote alerts are sent.
Decommissioned - Devices are not monitored and do not appear on the dashboard; no remote alerts are sent.
